methods.name: setPagination
methods.description: Unless using an external pagination Object (through 'v-model:pagination' prop), you can use this method and force the internal pagination to change

methods.name: prevPage
methods.description: Navigates to previous page, if available

methods.name: nextPage
methods.description: Navigates to next page, if available

methods.name: isRowSelected
methods.description: Determine if a row has been selected by user

methods.name: clearSelection
methods.description: Clears user selection (emits 'update:selected' with empty array)

methods.name: isRowExpanded
methods.description: Determine if a row is expanded or not

methods.name: setExpanded
methods.description: Sets the expanded rows keys array; Especially useful if not using an external 'expanded' state otherwise just emits 'update:expanded' with the value

methods.name: resetVirtualScroll
methods.description: Resets the virtual scroll (if using it) computations; Needed for custom edge-cases

methods.name: scrollTo
methods.description: Scroll the table to the row with the specified index in page (0 based)

events.name: row-click
events.description: Emitted when user clicks/taps on a row; Is not emitted when using body/row/item scoped slots
events.params: (evt: undefined, row: Object, index: Number) => void

events.name: row-dblclick
events.description: Emitted when user quickly double clicks/taps on a row; Is not emitted when using body/row/item scoped slots; Please check JS dblclick event support before using
events.params: (evt: undefined, row: Object, index: Number) => void

events.name: row-contextmenu
events.description: Emitted when user right clicks/long taps on a row; Is not emitted when using body/row/item scoped slots
events.params: (evt: undefined, row: Object, index: Number) => void

events.name: request
events.description: Emitted when a server request is triggered

events.name: update:pagination
events.description: Used by Vue on 'v-model:pagination' for updating its value

events.name: update:selected
events.description: Used by Vue on 'v-model:selected' prop for updating its value

events.name: update:expanded
events.description: Used by Vue on 'v-model:expanded' prop for updating its value

events.name: virtual-scroll
events.description: Emitted when the virtual scroll occurs, if using virtual scroll

row-key.description: Property of each row that defines the unique key of each row (the result must be a primitive, not Object, Array, etc); The value of property must be string or a function taking a row and returning the desired (nested) key in the row; If supplying a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

virtual-scroll.description: Display data using QVirtualScroll (for non-grid mode only)

virtual-scroll-slice-size.description: Minimum number of rows to render in the virtual list

virtual-scroll-slice-ratio-before.description: Ratio of number of rows in visible zone to render before it

virtual-scroll-slice-ratio-after.description: Ratio of number of rows in visible zone to render after it

virtual-scroll-item-size.description: Default size in pixels of a row; This value is used for rendering the initial table; Try to use a value close to the minimum size of a row

virtual-scroll-sticky-size-start.description: Size in pixels of the sticky header (if using one); A correct value will improve scroll precision; Will be also used for non-virtual-scroll tables for fixing top alignment when using scrollTo method

virtual-scroll-sticky-size-end.description: Size in pixels of the sticky footer part (if using one); A correct value will improve scroll precision

table-colspan.description: The number of columns in the table (you need this if you use table-layout: fixed)

color.description: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette
color.desc: Color name for selected nodes (from the Quasar Color Palette)

icon-first-page.desc: Icon name following Quasar convention for stepping to first page; Make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix

icon-prev-page.desc: Icon name following Quasar convention for stepping to previous page; Make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix

icon-next-page.desc: Icon name following Quasar convention for stepping to next page; Make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix

icon-last-page.desc: Icon name following Quasar convention for stepping to last page; Make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix

grid.description: Display data as a grid instead of the default table

dense.desc: Dense mode; Connect with $q.screen for responsive behavior

visible-columns.description: Array of Strings defining column names ('name' property of each column from 'columns' prop definitions); Columns marked as 'required' are not affected by this property

loading.description: Put Table into 'loading' state; Notify the user something is happening behind the scenes

hide-bottom.description: Hide table bottom layer regardless of what it has to display

hide-selected-banner.description: Hide the selected rows banner (if any)

hide-no-data.description: Hide the default no data bottom layer

hide-pagination.description: Hide the pagination controls at the bottom

separator.description: Use a separator/border between rows, columns or all cells

binary-state-sort.description: Skip the third state (unsorted) when user toggles column sort direction

column-sort-order.description: Set column sort order: 'ad' (ascending-descending) or 'da' (descending-ascending); It gets applied to all columns unless a column has its own sortOrder specified in the 'columns' definition prop

no-data-label.description: Override default text to display when no data is available

no-results-label.description: Override default text to display when user filters the table and no matched results are found

loading-label.description: Override default text to display when table is in loading state (see 'loading' prop)

selected-rows-label.description: Text to display when user selected at least one row; For best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

rows-per-page-label.description: Text to override default rows per page label at bottom of table

pagination-label.description: Text to override default pagination label at bottom of table (unless 'pagination' scoped slot is used); For best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

table-style.description: CSS style to apply to native HTML <table> element's wrapper (which is a DIV)

table-class.description: CSS classes to apply to native HTML <table> element's wrapper (which is a DIV)

table-header-style.description: CSS style to apply to header of native HTML <table> (which is a TR)

table-header-class.description: CSS classes to apply to header of native HTML <table> (which is a TR)

card-container-style.description: CSS style to apply to the cards container (when in grid mode)

card-container-class.description: CSS classes to apply to the cards container (when in grid mode)

card-style.description: CSS style to apply to the card (when in grid mode) or container card (when not in grid mode)

card-class.description: CSS classes to apply to the card (when in grid mode) or container card (when not in grid mode)

title-class.description: CSS classes to apply to the title (if using 'title' prop)

filter.description: String/Object to filter table with; When using an Object it requires 'filter-method' to also be specified since it will be a custom filtering

filter-method.description: The actual filtering mechanism; For best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

pagination.description: Pagination object; You can also use the 'v-model:pagination' for synching; When not synching it simply initializes the pagination on first render

rows-per-page-options.description: Options for user to pick (Numbers); Number 0 means 'Show all rows in one page'

expanded.description: Keeps the array with expanded rows keys

sort-method.description: The actual sort mechanism. Function (rows, sortBy, descending) => sorted rows; For best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline
